page.title: 09MANOR FARM, HOPTON
page.content: Manor Farm is owned and run by Messers Phoenix, a father-son partnership. They employ another man who lives six miles away. This is a mixed farm rearing 32 beef cattle, 400 pigs and growing winter wheat, winter barley, sugar beet and carrots on 316 acres. The animal's food is either brought in or home produced. The cattle are bought from a dealer in Northampton and are sold to a slaughterhouse. The farmers use a combine harvester, a bailer, a sugar beet harvester and 7 tractors. The farmers work throughout the year and have two weeks annual holiday, the farm worker has three weeks. The main difficulties of farming are the pests and diseases.
